titleStmt.title: W. F. Camden to James F. Robinson
CWG14052

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
Waynesburg nov 13th 1862
To the Military Govner of the state of Ky
Dear Sir

I want the permushion from you to make up a company of 60 men in the county of Lincoln and state of Kintucky my object is, to put down theeving tha are braeking in to stores, in this, place and Kneghbours, Houses, and stailing negroes, and in fact all Kind of depedatians, now i prpose to have these men Augurinesed and we dont want to takx the Goverment with Horses wit We will ride our on when Nessesary but we would properly want Some guns and ammunition and i would Like for your Honor to in struct me what to do and how to manage the cause if you permit me to Rais said company if i rais said company if it will be of old men. and buoys and i can get them in 24 Hours please to me a mediately Respectfully your obidiant survant

Waynesburg Ky,
Nov. 13/62
Camden. W. F.
Authority to raise troop to protect his region.
Leave asked to raise men in Lincoln
